FuncDef:
The radius-server accounting-interim-packet command enables RADIUS real-time accounting packet caching and configures the number of real-time accounting packet retransmissions.
The undo radius-server accounting-interim-packet command restores the default configuration.
By default, RADIUS real-time accounting packet caching is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of real-time accounting packet retransmissions.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535. The default value is 50.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In RADIUS accounting scenarios, if the link between the RADIUS server and device fails or is busy, the device caches real-time accounting packets that fail to be sent. The device sends the packets to the RADIUS server after the link recovers.
Configuration Impact
If the device fails to send real-time accounting packets to the RADIUS server after the radius-server accounting-interim-packet command is run, the device caches the packets to a queue and retransmits them at a certain interval. If the number of a real-time accounting packet's retransmissions reaches the value specified by the parameter resend-number and the packet still fails to be sent, the device discards the packet.
After the radius-server accounting-interim-packet command is run, the maximum number of accounting start and stop packets that can be cached is reduced, because real-time accounting packets consume the system caching space.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
